oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Trapping of Lygus rugulipennis in Norwegian strawberry crops
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Storberget, Sverre
Trandem, Nina
Borg-Karlson, Anna-Karin
Cross, Jerry
Fountain, Michelle
Hall, David
Ralle, Baiba
Sigsgaard, Lene
Wibe, Atle
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Crop health, quality, protection
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: European tarnished plant bug (ETB) sex pheromone traps in Norwegian strawberry must be deployed very early in the season to maximize catches. To trap females or the new generation, other attractants must be added. The strawberry blossom weevil attractant PV2 may act as a slight antagonist in ETB trapping, especially early in the season.
oai_dc:dc.dc:identifier: Storberget, Sverre; Trandem, Nina; Borg-Karlson, Anna-Karin; Cross, Jerry; Fountain, Michelle; Hall, David; Ralle, Baiba; Sigsgaard, Lene and Wibe, Atle (2013) Trapping of Lygus rugulipennis in Norwegian strawberry crops. In: NJF Report, 9 (465), pp. 35-36.
